intro: Psychotria argoviensis, commonly known as the Argoviensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Psychotria argoviensis is also noted for its role in ecological interactions, particularly as a host plant for certain species of insects.
